snippet: New research questions the notion, popular in tech circles, that the benefits of technology are making up for mediocre gains in productivity and wages.
abstract: Tyler Cowen Economic View column examines work of Chad Syverson, economics professor at University of Chicago Booth School of Business who has authored working paper on slowdown of productivity growth in America; observes that research challenges notion held in tech circles that technology is compensating for mediocre growth in productivity and wages.
lead_paragraph: New research questions the notion, popular in tech circles, that the benefits of technology are making up for mediocre gains in productivity and wages.

headline.print_headline: A Slowdown That Silicon Valley Doesn’t Believe
headline.main: Silicon Valley Has Not Saved Us From a Productivity Slowdown
